alert.note: Alert for Butler; Hamilton (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 1:25PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN DEARBORN, NORTHERN KENTON, NORTHERN BOONE, WESTERN HAMILTON AND SOUTHWESTERN BUTLER COUNTIES THROUGH 200 PM EDT... At 125 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Aurora, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Covington, Florence, Erlanger, Newport, Harrison, North College Hill, Edgewood, Elsmere, Cheviot, Fort Mitchell, Villa Hills, Mount Healthy, Fort Wright, Lawrenceburg, Greendale, Ludlow, Crescent Springs, Aurora and Crestview Hills. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 3. I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 167 and 171. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 19. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 179 and 191. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 6. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
